intro: Protium copal var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth copal tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
